column4: 1st: get debs from http://welcome.solutions.brother.com/bsc/public_s/id/linux/en/download_prn.html#HL-2280DW
ok, then what?
install them, "sudo dpkg -i *.deb" in the dir you downloaded them to
ok, so download relevant debs, sudo dpkg -i them, and then look for it on the network?
open "localhost:631" in your browser, add a printer, use "socket://192.168.x.y" or whatever your printers IP is as device
thanks
you have to use dpkg --force-architecture ....deb
Brother doesn't ship 64bit-packages
thanks
little help?
with?
browser, localhost:631, add printer, if your printer isn't listed enter it manually using your 2280DW driver and "socket://ip.adr.of.printer" as device
drvier - Brother - scroll the list, there should be a driver for the 2280dw listed now
it's assigning ip by dhcp is that ok?

another roadblock:  Queue not Enabled ... reason given is "Destination printer does not exist!"... and every time I "enable" it in the policies on the print manager, it immediately resets to off when I click "apply"
did you enter the correct IP in the device-field? can you ping that ip?
where do I find the ip in the device field? Is it a pure numeric ip?
you should have been asked for a device/port when installing the printer. there you should have entered "socket://192.168.x.y"   or whatever your printers IP is
i have to leave now, good luck
thanks
and I see four brother models, and I've just been selecting the first one.
